title: Tapestry: "the Triumph of Hope"
provenance_text:
Unknown Flemish, Brussels. (Symons, Inc., London, England and New York, NY, by 1926?); (purchased by French and Company, New York, NY, 1926? until October 24, 1928); sold to William Randolph Hearst [1863-1951], New York, NY, October 24, 1928 until 1951 [1]; Mrs. William Randolph Hearst [1882-1974] [2]; Hearst Foundation, New York, NY, by 1954; gift to Department of Fine Arts, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, 1954. 
NOTES: [1] William Randolph Hearst purchased this work from French and Company for $35,000. It was stock number 30521. [2] Her birth name was Millicent Veronica Willson, and she is also referred to as Millicent Hearst.
